Summary Note:
The RM is a close family friend of Elisabeth Lea Gmür's parents, having known her since birth. This deep-rooted connection has facilitated a strong and trustworthy professional relationship.
Elisabeth Lea Gmür is a seasoned professional with over 37 years of experience.
Seeking a trusted partner for wealth management, she joined Julius Baer for its comprehensive and tailored services.
Family Background: Elisabeth Lea Gmür and Kammermann have been married since 1996. They do not have any children.
Education Background:
Elisabeth obtained her secondary school diploma from Wirtschaftsgymnasium Basel Basel in 1984.
Elisabeth pursued higher education at University of Geneva, graduating in 1987.
Occupation History:
Having worked for over 37 years, Elisabeth Lea Gmür brings a wealth of experience and expertise to her current role. She is known for her strategic thinking and ability to drive results.
Elisabeth Lea Gmür began her professional journey as a Associate Attorney at Homburger AG in 1988, laying the foundation for future success.
In 1993, she moved to Schellenberg Wittmer Ltd. to work as a Senior Associate, applying her knowledge to achieve outstanding performance.
From 1997 to 1998, she served as a Partner at Niederer Kraft Frey AG, solidifying her position as a leader in the industry.
Her next role was as a Managing Partner at Bär & Karrer AG, where she applied her extensive experience to drive innovation from 1999 till retirement.
Wealth Summary:
During her work, she focused on financial growth, making diverse investments and ultimately saving 3210000 CHF.
Her remarkable portfolio comprises 2 stunning properties. Situated in prime locations across Winterthur and Aarau, these assets demonstrate their sophisticated understanding of real estate investments and high-end lifestyle preferences.
She inherited 1700000 CHF from her grandmother, a well-known Oil and Gas Executive, in 2008, allowing her to expand her investment portfolio.
Client Summary: In conclusion, we are confident in the client's financial stability and future prospects.
